basejump 0.6.1
  • Reference

Gene-to-Symbol Mappings from GFF File

Source: R/makeGene2symbolFromGFF.R
makeGene2symbolFromGFF.Rd

The GFF (General Feature Format) format consists of one line per feature, each containing 9 columns of data, plus optional track definition lines. The GTF (General Transfer Format) is identical to GFF version 2.

makeGene2symbolFromGFF(file)

Arguments

file

string. File path.

Value

data.frame.

See also

Other Gene Annotation Functions: annotable, broadClass, convertGenesToSymbols, convertTranscriptsToGenes, convertUCSCBuildToEnsembl, detectOrganism, emptyRanges, hgnc2gene, makeGRangesFromEnsembl, makeGRangesFromGFF, makeGene2symbolFromEnsembl, makeTx2geneFromEnsembl, makeTx2geneFromGFF, mgi2gene, stripTranscriptVersions

Examples

# GTF
x <- makeGene2symbolFromGFF("http://basejump.seq.cloud/example.gtf")
#> Making gene2symbol from GFF
#> Reading example.gtf
#> Ensembl GTF detected
glimpse(x)
#> Observations: 17
#> Variables: 2
#> $ geneID   <chr> "ENSMUSG00000025900", "ENSMUSG00000051951", "ENSMUSG000000...
#> $ geneName <chr> "Rp1", "Xkr4", "Gm26206", "Gm27396", "Gm1992", "Gm19938", ...

# GFFv3
x <- makeGene2symbolFromGFF("http://basejump.seq.cloud/example.gff3")
#> Making gene2symbol from GFF
#> Reading example.gff3
#> Ensembl GFF detected
glimpse(x)
#> Observations: 20
#> Variables: 2
#> $ geneID   <chr> "ENSMUSG00000025900", "ENSMUSG00000025902", "ENSMUSG000000...
#> $ geneName <chr> "Rp1", "Sox17", "Xkr4", "Gm26206", "Gm27396", "Gm1992", "G...
